alert.note: Alert for Southeast Elbert County Below 6000 Feet, South Lincoln County (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 26 at 6:29PM MDT by NWS Boulder
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Lincoln County through 715 PM MDT... At 629 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 11 miles west of Boyero, or 24 miles southeast of Limon, moving south at 20 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Punkin Center, Boyero and Karval. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.

area.areaDesc: Southeast Elbert County Below 6000 Feet, South Lincoln County
